docs.text: Welcome ¶ Welcome to the documentation of the PurrBot API! The PurrBot API consists of two separate APIs which work independant from each other: The PurrBotAPI and the ImageAPI. PurrBotAPI ¶ The PurrBotAPI was created to generate images that either look like messages from Discord, or an avatar with a status icon attached (Similar to how avatars look in a user profile). Source code Documentation ImageAPI ¶ The ImageAPI was created as a replacement for the nekos.life API. Similar to that API does this one serve randomly selected images, based on what path you provided. The reason behind the creation of this API was, to have more control over what images are displayed, as the nekos.life API may display images that can be considered against Discord's ToS (e.g. Depicting NSFW-lolis). Source code Documentation
docs.title: Welcome

docs.text: Welcome to the documentation of the PurrBot API! The PurrBot API consists of two separate APIs which work independant from each other: The PurrBotAPI and the ImageAPI.

docs.text: The ImageAPI was created as a replacement for the nekos.life API. Similar to that API does this one serve randomly selected images, based on what path you provided. The reason behind the creation of this API was, to have more control over what images are displayed, as the nekos.life API may display images that can be considered against Discord's ToS (e.g. Depicting NSFW-lolis). Source code Documentation
docs.title: ImageAPI

docs.text: ImageAPI ¶ The ImageAPI was created to be a replacement for the nekos.life API in the bot *Purr*. It is publicly available to use. Important All requests are performed through GET requests No JSON body or similiar is required for the API. SFW (Safe for work) endpoints ¶ Contains images that are considered safe for work. Base-URL https://purrbot.site/api/img/sfw /background/img ¶ Example response: { "code" : 200 , "link" : "https://purrbot.site/img/sfw/background/img/gradient_orange.png" } /cuddle/gif ¶ Example response: { "code" : 200 , "link" : "https://purrbot.site/img/sfw/cuddle/gif/cuddle_001.gif" } /holo/img ¶ Example response: { "code" : 200 , "link" : "https://purrbot.site/img/sfw/holo/img/holo_001.jpg" } /hug/gif ¶ Example response: { "code" : 200 , "link" : "https://purrbot.site/img/sfw/hug/gif/hug_001.gif" } /icon/img ¶ Example response: { "code" : 200 , "link" : "https://purrbot.site/img/sfw/icon/img/purr.png" } /kiss/gif ¶ Example response: { "code" : 200 , "link" : "https://purrbot.site/img/sfw/kiss/gif/kiss_001.gif" } /kitsune/img ¶ Example response: { "code" : 200 , "link" : "https://purrbot.site/img/sfw/kitsune/img/kitsune_001.jpg" } /lick/gif ¶ Example response: { "code" : 200 , "link" : "https://purrbot.site/img/sfw/lick/gif/lick_001.gif" } /neko/:type ¶ :type can be either gif for gifs or img for images. Example response: { "code" : 200 , "link" : "https://purrbot.site/img/sfw/neko/img/neko_001.jpg" } /pat/gif ¶ Example response: { "code" : 200 , "link" : "https://purrbot.site/img/sfw/pat/gif/pat_001.gif" } /poke/gif ¶ Example response: { "code" : 200 , "link" : "https://purrbot.site/img/sfw/poke/gif/poke_001.gif" } /slap/gif ¶ Example response: { "code" : 200 , "link" : "https://purrbot.site/img/sfw/slap/gif/slap_001.gif" } /tickle/gif ¶ Example response: { "code" : 200 , "link" : "https://purrbot.site/img/sfw/tickle/gif/tickle_001.gif" } NSFW (Not safe for work) endpoints ¶ Contains images that are considered Not Safe for work. Base-URL https://purrbot.site/api/img/nsfw /blowjob/gif ¶ Example response: { "code" : 200 , "link" : "https://purrbot.site/img/nsfw/blowjob/gif/blowjob_001.gif" } /fuck/gif ¶ Example response: { "code" : 200 , "link" : "https://purrbot.site/img/nsfw/fuck/gif/fuck_001.gif" } /neko/:type ¶ :type can be either gif for gifs or img for images. Example response: { "code" : 200 , "link" : "https://purrbot.site/img/nsfw/neko/img/neko_001" } /solo/gif ¶ Example response: { "code" : 200 , "link" : "https://purrbot.site/img/nsfw/solo/gif/solo_001.gif" } /threesome_fff/gif ¶ Example response: { "code" : 200 , "link" : "https://purrbot.site/img/nsfw/threesome_fff/gif/threesome_001.gif" } /threesome_ffm/gif ¶ Example response: { "code" : 200 , "link" : "https://purrbot.site/img/nsfw/threesome_ffm/gif/threesome_001.gif" } /threesome_mmf/gif ¶ Example response: { "code" : 200 , "link" : "https://purrbot.site/img/nsfw/threesome_mmf/gif/threesome_001.gif" } /yuri/gif ¶ Example response: { "code" : 200 , "link" : "https://purrbot.site/img/nsfw/yuri/gif/yuri_001.gif" } Failed requests ¶ The API can return one of two error responses, depending on which one is the case. Not existing path When you connect to an API path which does not exist (e.g. /api/img/doesntexist ) will this error response be displayed. { "code" : 403 , "message" : "Not supported API path" } Path doesn't contain any images If the provided path doesn't contain any images, will this error be displayed. { "code" : 403 , "message" : "The selected directory doesn't contain any images" }
docs.title: ImageAPI

docs.text: The API can return one of two error responses, depending on which one is the case. Not existing path When you connect to an API path which does not exist (e.g. /api/img/doesntexist ) will this error response be displayed. { "code" : 403 , "message" : "Not supported API path" } Path doesn't contain any images If the provided path doesn't contain any images, will this error be displayed. { "code" : 403 , "message" : "The selected directory doesn't contain any images" }
docs.title: Failed requests

docs.text: PurrBotAPI ¶ API used to create dynamic images based on the provided input. Base-URL https://purrbot.site/api Important All requests are performed through POST requests The request body needs to contain valid JSON. Even when it is empty. /quote ¶ Generates images that look like Discord messages Info Returns an image on success and JSON on failure. All provided values need to be String. Leave away a field and value to use the default option. Fields ¶ Field Description Default avatar The URL of the avatar to display. https://i.imgur.com/36aniDJ.png dateFormat The format in which the date should be displayed. This uses the SimpleDateFormat dd. MMM yyyy hh:mm:ss message The message itself to display. This won't format markdown, emotes and only formats selected emojis. Some message nameColor The color, in which the name should be displayed. You can provide hex:rrggbb , rgb:r,g,b or the raw color value. hex:ffffff timestamp The date and time as epoch milliseconds. <Current time of the request> username The name to display. Someone Example Request { "avatar" : "https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/204232208049766400/dfaaefa54a2804addb1f494da7aa904d.png" , "message" : "This is an example message." , "nameColor" : "hex:ffffff" , "dateFormat" : "dd. MMM yyyy" , "username" : "Andre_601" } Result /status ¶ Adds a status icon to the provided avatar Info Returns an image on success and JSON on failure. All provided values need to be String. Leave away a field and value to use the default option. Fields ¶ Field Description Default avatar The URL of the avatar to display. https://i.imgur.com/36aniDJ.png status The status to set as icon. Can be online , idle , do_not_disturb (or dnd ) or offline offline Example Request { "avatar" : "https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/204232208049766400/dfaaefa54a2804addb1f494da7aa904d.png" , "status" : "online" } Result Error responses ¶ The API might return certain errors, depending on different facors. Possible errors are a 500 Internal Server Error or a 403 Unauthorized Error . 500 Internal Server Error In the case of a 500 Internal Server Error will you need to check the provided values as those may be invalid. Common cause could be a image-link that is no longer valid. { "code" : 500 , "message" : "Couldn't generate image. Make sure the values are valid!" } 403 Unauthorized Error When a 403 Unauthorized Error happens does it mean, that your provided JSON body is not valid. This either means, that you didn't provide a valid JSON (i.e. a comma is missing) or you didn't provide any JSON at all. { "code" : 403 , "message" : "Invalid or empty JSON-body received!" }
docs.title: PurrBotAPI

MMM yyyy" , "username" : "Andre_601" } Result

Possible errors are a 500 Internal Server Error or a 403 Unauthorized Error . 500 Internal Server Error In the case of a 500 Internal Server Error will you need to check the provided values as those may be invalid.
